tweets.text:
FLOOD PATROL UPDATE 4pm 8/12/2020.

Slash lane, Sileby remain Impassable and Closed üöß‚ö†Ô∏è due to Flooding/Debris ‚ö†Ô∏è

Mountsorrel lane, Sileby (between Slash lane - A6 bypass) is Passable with ‚ö†Ô∏è due to Flooding & Debris so use ‚ö†Ô∏è

Broome lane - Clear but but use ‚ö†Ô∏è due to Debris. https://t.co/ZzYlbPuS8e

#TeamEA have been out today clearing debris from river grids like here on the Wirral. 

Removing leaves and other debris from rivers allows them to flow freely without obstruction üçÇ https://t.co/eNw0PBk6lV
@WildLakeland @JamieHutt0n @EnvAgency They call it when looking downstream Rob - hence the left hand bank in the pic

A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW

@JamieHutt0n @EnvAgency "left hand bank directly upstream of the bridge" is quoted twice by them of needing possible attention - all this work has been done on the right-hand bank. lets hope they don't get their left and right mixed up!

#IYMI we‚Äôre giving ¬£3.9 million to #PlantMoreTrees outside of woodlands, in our cities, towns and rivers. 

Watch our video to find out more üëá
https://t.co/PuTzpXbZrB 

@EnvAgency #TogetherForOurPlanet https://t.co/YTexLSWSVk

BEFORE & AFTER

Appalling #EcoVandalism at The #RiverLugg SSSI #Herefordshire

THIS IS ILLEGAL ACTIVITY

So it's a CRITICAL TEST CASE for environmental enforcement by @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK

The @WildlifeTrusts will be making sure appropriate legal action is taken https://t.co/U8lt4ZuX1t

Hot off the press; Ryevitalise loves trees üå≥! Through   Woodlands for Water, we'll be planting over 12,800 of them in the River Rye Catchment, helping improve water quality and habitat. Watch this spruce for updates... @EnvAgencyYNE @northyorkmoors #ryevitalise https://t.co/Qcr4XBL4pP

@CroxtethHall @lpoolcouncil @CroxtethCampus @CroxtethFarm ‚ö†Ô∏èIf going for a walk #flooding on paths surrounding park,  exit from Craven Wood #Knowsley brook banks burst @MerseyRivers @EnvAgency #flood #rain @merseyforest #weather https://t.co/iQGUM4jmpT

#Rickerby Flood Risk Management Scheme has reached completion

#IYMI we‚Äôre putting ¬£1.4 million towards funding 15 community projects to plant more trees near rivers and streams.

#PlantMoreTrees #NationalTreeWeek #TogetherForOurPlanet https://t.co/jQvvNELLdy

In her latest blog, @HelenStace_HWT notes that @EnvAgency figures from September showed "a magnificent 0% of river, lakes and streams in England are in good health" and she calls for a strong Environment Bill to tackle environmental destruction. 2/2 https://t.co/dvlxSvzTk0

Over a mile of scientifically important riverbank in Herefordshire was recently destroyed. This stretch of the River Lugg hasn't been inspected since 2010 and the CEO of the local Wildlife Trust says budget cuts and enforcement resources are a big problem. 1/2

tweets.text: We're mounting a wide-ranging investigation into reports of damage to the #RiverLugg, which is protected through SSSI status. We're treating this very seriously, working with @NaturalEngland & @ForestryComm who have taken immediate action to prevent any further works at the site. https://t.co/bvhnTETfal

This is a nailed-on, caught-red-handed case of environmental vandalism in a protected status site. Yet landowner & Parish Council seemingly claim permission was granted?!

Let's hope this becomes a landmark case for @EnvAgency which ensures it never happens again. #RiverLugg https://t.co/C2BBdysWJH

At this time of year wild brown trout and salmon are spawning, laying eggs in the gravels on riverbeds.

Even by walking up a river you will have utterly destroyed those incubating eggs. Guess what impact a bulldozer has.

https://t.co/8QES9U47dG

@picturespete @NorthHertsDC @AquiferChalk @IvelRev @EnvAgency Hi Peter, thanks for getting back in touch. Our technician arrived on site and noticed the manhole next to the storm tank was full, so this was passed directly to our treatment team who attended site the same day to sort the issue. They've advised this is now resolved. Thank you

@AnglianWater @NorthHertsDC @AquiferChalk @IvelRev @EnvAgency @AnglianWater Hi again folks... so, what was the outcome this time? Clearly not designed to flow to the river at that point: blockage further along the drain from there, maybe?

@picturespete @NorthHertsDC @AquiferChalk @IvelRev @EnvAgency Hi Peter. I'm sorry to hear that this has happened again. I've raised that under a new job reference - 58258445 - but linked it to the previous occurrence. We'll be out asap today to get that sorted. Thanks for letting us know and sorry again, Kate
